choices.D: Intra-Area (O) - NSSA Type 1 (N1) - External Type 1 (E1) - Inter-Area (O IA) - NSSA Type 2 (N2) - External Type 2 (E2)
choices.F: NSSA Type 1 (N1) - NSSA Type 2 (N2) - Intra-Area (O) - Inter-Area (O IA) - External Type 1 (E1) - External Type 2 (E2) A
choices.E: Intra-Area (O) - Inter-Area (O IA) - NSSA Type 1 (N1) - External Type 1 (E1) - NSSA Type 2 (N2) - External Type 2 (E2)
choices.C: Intra-Area (O) - Inter-Area (O IA) - NSSA Type 1 (N1) - External Type 1 (E1) - NSSA Type 2 (N2) - External Type 2 (E2)
choices.A: Intra-Area (O) - Inter-Area (O IA) - External Type 1 (E1) - External Type 2 (E2) - NSSA Type 1 (N1) - NSSA Type 2 (N2)
choices.B: Intra-Area (O) - Inter-Area (O IA) - NSSA Type 1 (N1) - NSSA Type 2 (N2) - External Type 1 (E1) - External Type 2 (E2)

questions.question_text: OSPF chooses routes in which order, regardless of route's administrative distance and metric?
questions.answer_description:
Regardless of a route's metric or administrative distance, OSPF will choose routes in the following order:
Intra-Area (O)
Inter-Area (O IA)
External Type 1 (E1)
External Type 2 (E2)
NSSA Type 1 (N1)
NSSA Type 2 (N2)

discussion.content: Intra-Area (O) - Inter-Area (O IA) - External Type 1 (E1) - External Type 2 (E2) - NSSA Type 1 (N1) - NSSA Type 2 (N2)

"For default behavior, you can simplify the formula as follows:
metric = bandwidth + delay"

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/enhanced-interior-gateway-routing-protocol-eigrp/16406-eigrp-toc.html

questions.question_text: Which calculation is used to determine the default EIGRP metric?

choices.A: adding a static route for the VRF that points to the global route table
choices.C: adding dynamic routing between the two routers and advertising the loopback
choices.B: adding the loopback to the VRF
choices.F: adding all interfaces to the global and VRF routing tables AB
choices.D: adding the IP address of the loopback to the export route targets for the VRF
choices.E: adding a static route for the VRF that points to the loopback interface

discussion.content: CORRECT ANSWERS ARE A AND B.

B is correct and
route leaking between global and vrf routing table
I think the correct answers are B C

questions.question_text: A network engineer has set up VRF-Lite on two routers where all the interfaces are in the same VRF. At a later time, a new loopback is added to Router 1, but it cannot ping any of the existing interfaces. Which two configurations enable the local or remote router to ping the loopback from any existing interface? (Choose two.)
What happens when a router receives a packet with a TTL of 0?

discussion.content: The router sends an ICMP Time Exceeded Message to the host that sent the packet

choices.A: The router attempts to forward the packet along an alternate path in the route table
choices.B: The router sends an ICMP Time Exceeded Message to the host that sent the packet
choices.C: The router sends an ICMP Destination Unreachable Message to the host that sent the packet
choices.D: The router flags the packet and forwards it to the next hop B

choices.B: When users attempt to connect to vty lines 0 4, the device will authenticate them against TACACS+ if local authentication fails
choices.D: The device will allow only users at 192.168.0.202 to connect to vty line 0 4 A
choices.A: The device will authenticate all users connecting to vty lines 0 4 against TACACS+
choices.C: The device will allow users at 192.168.0.202 to connect to vty lines 0 4 using the password ciscotestkey

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit. Which effect of this configuration is true?

discussion.content: The device will authenticate all users connecting to vty lines 0 4 against TACACS+.
